configure.p: The SVGConcatenate actor concatenates an array of SVG (Scalable Vector Graphics) files. The actor reads an array of SVG file names. Using a specified x- and y-offset, the actor concatenates the files and outputs the path of the concatenated file, which can be displayed by the BrowserDisplay actor.
SVG files are high resolution graphical images that can be scaled without loss.

property.name: port:outputPath
property.configure: An input port that accepts the file path for the concatenated output file. See FileParameter for more information about specifying filenames. The path may also be specified with the svgOutputFile parameter.

property.name: port:output
property.configure: An output port that broadcasts the URL of the concatenated SVG file.

property.name: port:svgFiles
property.configure: An input port that accepts an array of strings representing SVG filenames.

property.name: prop:outputPathParam
property.configure: The file name or URL of the output file.

property.name: prop:confirmOverwrite
property.configure: Specify whether to confirm before overwriting an existing output file or not.

property.name: prop:shiftY
property.configure: The y-offset to use during concatenation. By default, the value is 0.0.

property.name: prop:shiftX
property.configure: The x-offset to use during concatenation. By default, the value is 0.0.
